item.title: Getting Started with Terragrunt
item.description: Introduction This blog post is going to cover my initial journey into Terragrunt and deploying a simple S3 Bucket to AWS as per my previous examples as this is the simplest way to play with Terraform/grunt/whatever Lets DO IT Prerequisites As this tutorial utilises AWS make sure you have setup a AWS account and ran aws configure with the correct credentials, this page is helpful for this kinda thing: https://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/osx-installing-the-aws-command-line-interface-using-brew/

item.title: Using Terraform Workspaces to manage multi-env deployments
item.description: Using Terraform Workspaces to manage multi-env deployments Hi! This blog post will cover working with Terraform Workspaces that allow you to manage multiple enviroments under the same code, this is one of many ways to do this with terraform (see using --var-file=development.tfvars) and I was interested in figuring out how this would work, I can’t say it’s the right way but I can say it’s fairly straight forward however I have yet to use this at a large scale, so lets have a plan!

item.title: Dockerizing a Hugo Site
item.description: Introduction Alright I lied, I’ll do another blog post, seeing as you all asked so nicely! This post expands upon starting-a-hugo-site and will show you have to package up HUGO in docker, I mean sure you can just upload it to S3 in AWS and run as a static page, but if you’re like me you want to mess around with shiny things and I guess Docker is shiny? Getting Started Install Docker Homebrew is a package manager for macOS, can be installed from brew.
